result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin L Brockel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: First 4 months Jail (Straight Time). Balance with Huber, release for standard conditions if imposed.

miscConds.notes:
Cost and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 09-01-2015.  Failure to pay the Court orders 5 days Huber as Contempt for non-compliance with Court Order.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Defendant must work full time unless enrolled in an education program.

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with Lawrence B. and his residence. No Violent contact with Defendant's Mother. Complete an Anger Management Course. Complete a Cognitive Thinking Course. 
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
**10/20/15 COURT AMENDS CONDITIONS TO NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH FATHER, LAWRENCE B. **

*AS OF 11/10/2015: Court amends that Defendant may go to his father's house, Lawrence B. (this is in addition to the 10/20/15 amendment)

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time:  90 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - Last 26 days STAYED to be used at the Agent's Discretion.
Credit For Time Served 64 Days.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC.  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Proposed stip and order striking defendant's probation condition filed by State.

Proposed Order and stipulation with cover letter filed by State to amend Judgment of Conviction.

Order signed by Judge Maxwell 10/20/15
Motion to Amend Judgment of Conviction filed by State.

Defendant Kevin L Brockel in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court addresses the motion to modify conditions of probation.  Attorney Benedict requests that the Court modify the conditons of probation to allow for the Defendant to attend school.  The State does not have an objection to the request.  The Court grants the request.  The Court will modify the judgment of conviction to read:  Defendant must work full time unless enrolled in an education program.
Motion hearing on August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Modify Condition of Probation filed by Atty Benedict.

attached with State's witness list
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with Lawrence and Anne Brockel listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residence.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms. Defendant to have no contact with parent, Lawrence Brockel under protective order 940.47.   Defendant can have contact with Anne B. in custody at the jail.  If the defendant is released on bail the court will review contact order.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is granted Huber Bailee Status for work only.  Any violations for work release Huber will be revoked.    Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.    Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
